integrations_researched.name: @svar-ui/react-gantt

key_functions: Gantt component with tasks, links, scales props
Export to PDF, PNG, Excel, MS Project XML

data_structure.tasks: Array of task objects with id, text, start, end, duration, parent, type (task|summary|milestone)
data_structure.links: Array of link objects with id, source, target, type (e2e|e2s|s2e|s2s)
data_structure.scales: Timeline scale configuration (day, week, month, year)

gotchas: Community edition is MIT license, GitHub version is GPLv3
PRO features require commercial license
Optimized rendering for large datasets (thousands of tasks)
Backend integration examples available in Go
integrations_researched.recommendation: BEST OPEN-SOURCE OPTION - Feature-rich, actively maintained, MIT licensed, matches all requirements from reference design

integrations_researched.name: gantt-task-react

imports: import { Gantt, Task, EventOption, StylingOption, ViewMode, DisplayOption } from 'gantt-task-react'

gotchas: PACKAGE IS OUTDATED - Last published 3 years ago
May have compatibility issues with newer React versions
Consider using actively maintained forks instead
56,999 weekly downloads but no recent updates
integrations_researched.recommendation: NOT RECOMMENDED - Outdated package. Use @wamra/gantt-task-react fork instead

integrations_researched.name: @wamra/gantt-task-react

api_patterns.initialization: Same as gantt-task-react but with improved type definitions

gotchas: Fork of gantt-task-react with active maintenance
Better TypeScript support than original
Check documentation for any API differences from original
integrations_researched.recommendation: GOOD OPTION - Actively maintained fork of gantt-task-react with better TypeScript support

integrations_researched.name: react-google-charts
gotchas: LIMITED FEATURES - Basic Gantt functionality only
No hierarchical/collapsible tasks
No drag-and-drop editing
No milestones as distinct elements
Depends on Google Charts library (external dependency)
Limited customization compared to dedicated Gantt libraries
integrations_researched.recommendation: NOT RECOMMENDED - Too limited for the reference design requirements. Missing hierarchical tasks, milestones, and interactive editing

integrations_researched.name: dhtmlx-gantt (React)

key_functions: Multiple dependency types: Start-to-Start, Finish-to-Finish, Finish-to-Start, Start-to-Finish
Task types: regular tasks, projects, milestones

gotchas: COMMERCIAL LICENSE REQUIRED for production use
Trial version available for evaluation
Very feature-rich but comes with licensing costs
Optimized for React 18+
Well-documented but requires purchase for commercial projects
integrations_researched.recommendation: COMMERCIAL OPTION - Very feature-rich and well-supported, but requires commercial license

integrations_researched.name: frappe-gantt (React wrappers)

verified_package.name: frappe-gantt + multiple React wrappers
verified_package.install_command: npm install frappe-gantt-react OR npm install react-frappe-gantt OR npm install @artemostapov/frappe-gantt-react

gotchas: MULTIPLE OUTDATED WRAPPERS - Most wrappers last published 3-7 years ago
frappe-gantt-react: Last published 7 years ago
react-frappe-gantt: Last published 5 years ago
@artemostapov/frappe-gantt-react: Last published 1 year ago (most recent)
Limited features compared to dedicated Gantt libraries
No hierarchical tasks support
No milestones as distinct elements
Maintenance status unclear
integrations_researched.recommendation: NOT RECOMMENDED - Outdated wrappers, limited features, unclear maintenance

integrations_researched.name: D3.js-based Custom Gantt

api_patterns.initialization: Custom SVG rendering with D3 data binding

gotchas: REQUIRES SIGNIFICANT CUSTOM DEVELOPMENT
Must implement all Gantt features from scratch
Steep learning curve for D3.js
More development time and maintenance burden
Existing D3 Gantt examples are basic and outdated
Better to use purpose-built Gantt libraries unless very specific customization needed
integrations_researched.recommendation: NOT RECOMMENDED - Too much custom development required. Use purpose-built library instead

required_features: Hierarchical task structure with collapsible groups (Foundation, Framing, Electrical, Plumbing)
Task bars showing duration on timeline
Milestones with diamond-shaped markers (Foundation Complete, Roof Tight, Inspections)
Task list sidebar with task names
Professional BuilderOps Construction Project Timeline appearance

recommendations: PRIMARY RECOMMENDATION: Use @svar-ui/react-gantt
- MIT licensed, free for commercial use
- Matches ALL requirements from reference design: hierarchical tasks, dependencies, milestones, zoom, today indicator
- Modern: React 19 compatible, TypeScript support, actively maintained
- Feature-rich: drag-and-drop, task editing, export to multiple formats
- Well-documented with API reference and examples
ALTERNATIVE OPTION: @wamra/gantt-task-react
- If @svar-ui/react-gantt doesn't meet specific needs
- Actively maintained fork of popular gantt-task-react
- Better TypeScript support than original
- MIT licensed
AVOID:
- gantt-task-react (original) - outdated, 3 years since last update
- react-google-charts - too limited, missing key features
- frappe-gantt wrappers - outdated, limited features
- D3.js custom implementation - too much development effort
- Commercial options (DHTMLX, Bryntum) - unnecessary cost when good open-source options exist
INTEGRATION NOTES:
- The project already uses MUI v5, dayjs for dates, and TypeScript
- @svar-ui/react-gantt will integrate cleanly with existing stack
- May need custom styling to match MUI theme
- Consider using dayjs for date manipulation in task data
